channel.title: Wired internet doesn't work
channel.description: So my copy of windows xp no longer works for some reason, so I installed windows 7 (build 7000). My laptop is running it and runs it smoothly but on my desktop the wired Internet does not work. My wireless network still works otherwise I could not post this. My system sorts detects the hardware but won't detect it so I can install the drivers. It first tells me that it's detected but no drivers, I go to install the drivers and not detected. Help?

item.title: Wired internet doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Unhandled:

The reason XP drivers don’t work with Vista is because they completely rewrote the entire windows driver model. Windows 7 however, uses the same driver model as Vista, so you would think something as basic as an ethernet driver would work…

Exactly why I thought since it works with Vista it would work with win7. Ugh. I’ll just install Arch.

Read full topic

item.title: Wired internet doesn't work

item.description:

The reason XP drivers don’t work with Vista is because they completely rewrote the entire windows driver model. Windows 7 however, uses the same driver model as Vista, so you would think something as basic as an ethernet driver would work…

item.title: Wired internet doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Life™, post:11, topic:258037”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=340669.msg2638837#msg2638837 date=1232725955]
That’s no guarantee, I’m sure all vista drivers don’t work with 7, just like all XP drivers don’t work with vista.

Also remember you are working with beta (or is it even beta?) software, from microsoft. Their mature products don’t even work right most of the time (think IE)
[/quote]
It is beta, and the drives do NOT work with vista. Delete all your drives, throw the computer out the window then buy a better one.[/quote]
Why is it the computer’s fault when the OS doesn’t work properly?

Read full topic

item.title: Wired internet doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Life Java Is My Life™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Life wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:258037”]That’s no guarantee, I’m sure all vista drivers don’t work with 7, just like all XP drivers don’t work with vista.

Also remember you are working with beta (or is it even beta?) software, from microsoft. Their mature products don’t even work right most of the time (think IE)[/quote]
It is beta, and the drives do NOT work with vista. Delete all your drives, throw the computer out the window then buy a better one.

Read full topic

item.title: Wired internet doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:8, topic:258037”]inb4 get kubuntu

why doesn’t xp work anymore? You might just want to reinstall that.[/quote]
Idk just crapper out and it doesn’t realize that I’ve already installed it on my computer and says my licenses are all used up.

I don’t know much about these things but if you’re saying no drivers for my connection to my modem, but my wireless is connected to it, how does that work?

Read full topic

item.title: Wired internet doesn't work

item.description:
@BlazezFire wrote:

Try to order the wireless drivers for your computer (the disk).

item.title: Wired internet doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Also remember you are working with beta (or is it even beta?) software, from microsoft. Their mature products don’t even work right most of the time (think IE)

Yeah, it’s still in beta; and it’s extremely buggy, which would explain this situation. Stick with your wireless internet, or switch operating systems.

Read full topic

item.title: Wired internet doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’m not sure of what you’re asking, but wireless would use a different driver than your wired connection, and apparently your wireless driver just happens to work.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Holic wrote:

K. Damn. It doesn’t work hooked to directly to my computer or my router, but the wireless still works. Does it not need any interaction from my computer?
